From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia


2021 Indian action drama film


Mera Fauji CallingTheatrical release posterDirected byAaryaan SaxenaWritten byAaryaan SaxenaProduced byOvez Shaikh Vikram SinghAnil Jain Vijeta VermaStarringSharman JoshiVikram SinghBidita BagMugdha GodseZarina WahabShishir SharmaMahi SoniCinematographySubhranshu DasEdited byPravin AngreMusic byHarpriet Singh VigSajjad Ali ChandwaniVijay VermaProductioncompaniesRunning Horses Films Ovez ProductionsDistributed byPanorama StudiosRelease date
11 March 2021 (2021-03-11)
Running time128 minutesCountryIndiaLanguageHindi
Mera Fauji Calling (transl. My Soldier Calling) is a 2021 Hindi-language action drama film written and directed by Aaryaan Saxena and produced by Vikram Singh and Ovez Shaikh under the banners of Running Horses Films and Ovez Productions. The film bankrolled by Jimmy Satish Asija, has ensemble which includes Sharman Joshi, Ranjha Vikram Singh, Bidita Bag, Mahi Soni, Mugdha Godse, Zarina Wahab, and Shishir Sharma. The film showcases the story of a soldier who sacrifices his life in an attack and the struggle of his family after the attack.[1] Inspired by aftermath of 2019 Pulwama attack,[2] it also explores the various aspects of the life of soldiers and the struggle of their families.[3][4]
The film was released in cinemas on 11 March 2021.[5]


Cast[edit]
Sharman Joshi as Abhishek
Vikram Singh as Rajveer Singh
Bidita Bag as Sakshi Singh[6]
Mugdha Godse as Paridhi
Zarina Wahab as Maa ji, Rajveer Singh's mother
Shishir Sharma as Major Roy
Mahi Soni as Aaradhya
Ritu Shree as Bhoomi
Abhijita Kashyap as Kriti
Sidhi Jain as Suman
Rizwan Kalshyan as Jai Singh
Soundtrack[edit]
Mera Fauji CallingSoundtrack album by Harpriet Singh Vig, Sajjad Ali Chandwani and Vijay VermaReleased5 March 2021[7]Recorded2020GenreFeature film soundtrackLength26:49LanguageHindiLabelZee Music CompanyOfficial audioMera Fauji Calling - Full Album on YouTube

The film's music was composed by Harpriet Singh Vig, Sajjad Ali Chandwani and Vijay Verma while lyrics written by Pooja Saini, Traditional, A. M. Turaz, Rajesh Manthan and Shakeel Azmi.

References[edit]


^ "Fauji Calling poster out, makers open to theatrical and OTT release". Cinema Express. Retrieved 23 May 2020.

^ Gaba, Rajesh (23 February 2021). "भास्कर एक्सक्लूसिव इंटरव्यू:पुलवामा आतंकी हमले पर बनी है फिल्म, फौजी पिता का इंतजार करती छोटी बच्ची की कहानी" [Bhaskar Exclusive Interview:'Fauji Calling' is a film on Pulwama terror attack, the story of a little girl waiting for her father]. Dainik Bhaskar (in Hindi). Retrieved 23 February 2021.

^ "शरमन जोशी और मुग्धा गोडसे की फिल्म 'फौजी कालिंग' का मोशन पोस्टर हुआ लॉन्च, फिल्म की स्टार कास्ट आई नजर" [Motion poster of Sharman Joshi and Mugdha Godse's film 'Fauji Calling' launched, star cast of the film attended]. Dainik Jagran (in Hindi). 21 December 2019. Retrieved 23 May 2020.

^ Manglik, Reshu (11 February 2019). "Here's the first poster of Sharman Joshi's Fauji Calling". www.indiatvnews.com. Retrieved 23 May 2020.

^ Fauji Calling [@CallingFauji] (10 March 2021). "Fauji Calling now releasing on 11th March...  With the love, support and reactions we have been getting, we can see the #FaujiCalling wave is sweeping the nation—tax-free releases in Delhi, Haryana & Jharkhand.  #OneDayToGo" (Tweet) – via Twitter.

^ Kumar Raviraj Sinha (30 January 2021). "'Fauji Calling' is a film about hope: Bidita Bag". National Herald. Retrieved 23 February 2021.

^ "Mera Fauji Calling – Original Motion Picture Soundtrack". Jio Saavn. 5 March 2021.
